We wanted a proper breakfast.  Not one of those European breakfasts of rolls and crackers (that most hotels seem to offer).  This place looks like a bar, but they have umbrella tables (plus I think booths inside, though we didn't go inside).  The food was OK. Outdoor seating was nice except smoking is allowed in Spain, and folks at neighboring tables were doing it. This is a problem everywhere.  You don't realize how successful the anti-smoking campaign has been in the US until you go to Europe and it seems everywhere someone is smoking like a chimney.  It's actually obnoxious by American standards.  I guess Europeans don't get lung cancer???Anyway, reasonable prices (for Europe) and decent food.  I would come here again.
